channel.title: Ubuntu Problem
channel.description:
Okay so I'm using Ubuntu distro 10.10 and I'm having problems running private servers. I open up the client and I get an "error connecting to server try again in #" and I see that my cache files are null. Nullmain_file_cache.dat etc. So I tried the Moparscape client and I get the T1 - 123,0 - 36,36 error.. Any suggestions?
Thanks in advance.
Edit: Any server I try gets a T1 error when using the Mopar client. I am able to log on for about a half second..

item.title: Ubuntu Problem
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“OFWGKTA, post:7, topic:390919”]I got the signlink.class but I cannot open it with Leafpad, alternative program to open it ?

Edit: Get this error…

Could not open file - Using the character encoding… please check that you are not trying to open a binary file.[/quote]

It’s because it’s a class file(You obviously skipped to not asking for the source, and decompiled it). Get a Java Decompiler, decompile signlink.class, change what I told you to change, recompile, run.

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu Problem
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

OFWGKTA:

I don’t have a sign directory, I’m running off a .jar file…

You can’t fix it unless you edit the source. Extract the jar, and if it doesn’t have the source files, contact the person who released it and tell them that you’re trying to run the client, and that you would like the source so you can fix the error. If he declines, then just get a decompiler(any will work usually), make the changes, recompile, and run.

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu Problem
item.dc:creator: @OFWGKTA OFWGKTA
item.description:
@OFWGKTA wrote:

I don’t have a sign directory, I’m running off a .jar file…

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu Problem
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

OFWGKTA:

You mind pming me a step by step? Fairly new user…

I thought I did…

Anyway here’s what you do.

  1. Go into your client’s source files
  2. Go into the “sign” directory.
  3. Go to the method “findcachedir”
  4. Replace all that code with the code I previously posted.

As long as the cache is valid, and the client can find it, you should be able to connect. Some other things that don’t let it connect, is because of the CRC check when the client starts up, or if it can’t find the cache, it will request the cache from the server through port 43595. If the server isn’t set up for it, you can’t connect either.

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu Problem
item.dc:creator: @OFWGKTA OFWGKTA
item.description:
@OFWGKTA wrote:

You mind pming me a step by step? Fairly new user…

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu Problem
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

  1. Chances are, it’s looking for the cache in the C drive. Since Ubuntu doesn’t set letters to drives. Easiest way to do it is put the cache in ~(home), and then in the signlink class, under findcachedir() replace it with this:
public String findcachedir() {
    return String.format("%s/%s/", System.getProperty("user.name"), ".your_cache_name");
}
  1. Subsequently, since it can’t find the cache, and at start up, it gets the CRC values from the cache, it refuses to connect to any server, because it has no cache to load from.

Read full topic
